name: Atlanta (ATL) to Orlando (MCO) Full Flight Experience
description:
Thanks for watching this Full Flight Experience!  In May 2017 I had the opportunity to take a research trip to the Highlands of Scotland and experience some of my favorite locales in the world!  There were plenty of opportunities for walking, exploring, and recording my discoveries, and the fun started even before I arrived.

This six-part journey continues at ATL as I traverse the world's busiest airport from end to end to catch my second flight to Orlando International Airport aboard a brand-new Airbus 321. A common hop for vacationers and excited families, I'm catching my transatlantic flight in Orlando. You can't help but feel what the kids are feeling, though: excitement and anticipation for their trip to Disney World and the other fun things to do in the heart of Florida.

I've flown this leg myself on several occasions, but always as one of those happy kids. Like those kids, I'm on my way to exploration, and hope you enjoy the ride, too! I'll share some fun facts en route to our destination!

Thanks for flying in, and stay tuned for the upcoming legs of this journey to and from the British Isles!

--------------------------------

Flight Information
Airline: Delta Airlines
Flight Number: DAL897
Date of Flight: Saturday, May 6th, 2017

Origin Airport: Atlanta Hartsfield/Jackson International Airport (KATL/ATL)
Destination Airport: Orlando International Airport (KMCO/MCO)

Departing Gate: A1
Boarding Time: 12:42 EDT
Scheduled Departure: 12:54 EDT
Actual Departure from Gate: 13:00 EDT
Takeoff Runway and Time: RWY 9L / 13:07 EDT

Landing Runway and Time: RWY 36L / 14:10 EDT
Scheduled Arrival: 02:27 EST
Actual Arrival at Gate: 02:21 EST
Arriving Gate: 73

--------------------------------

Aircraft Information
Type: Airbus 321-200
Registration: N315DN 
Aircraft Delivery: December 2016
Engines: 2x CFM56-5
Seat: 21A

--------------------------------

Gear
Nikon D3200/18-55mm
Canon Vixia HFM30
Edited in Adobe Premiere Pro/IrfanView

Aircraft, flight information, and facts developed from Planespotters.net, flightaware.com, Google Maps, wikipedia.com, and atlairport.com. Labor statistics from sba.gov.

This video is the sole property of www.milesbyfoot.com.  Any unauthorized use of the video or audio content from this video is prohibited.  If you'd like to use any portion of this video, please e-mail me at milesbyfoot@gmail.com and I'll be happy work with you!
